reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a business trip.
reviews.title: Great location, reasonable hotel.

likes.disliked: — No internet access without your own laptop and no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms.

reviews.text: Overall, I found this a perfectly reasonable hotel. My room was fine, with comfy twin beds and clean, fresh bedding. A small wardrobe came stocked with lots of coat-hangers, which makes a refreshing change to other places I have stayed! The room was perfectly big enough for a short trip, although I think it would feel a little small for a couple staying for more than a few nights.
reviews.title: Price and Location Hard to Beat

reviews.text: The bathroom was open onto the room (toilet did have a door though), which was fine for me as I was travelling on my own. But given that this was a twin room, I thought the hotel should give some warning about this as not everyone travelling and booking a twin room will want to shower in front of their travelling companion! However, the shower was large and clean, with great water pressure.
reviews.title: Value for money
Good All Rounder
reviews.text: For me, the best thing about this hotel was its location. Just a couple of minutes walk from Freidrichstrasse station for easy access to anywhere in Berlin, and within 20 minutes walk of the Reichstag and Brandenburg Gate. In the evenings, Mitte is a great district to be in with loads of restaurants and bars. This hotel is just two blocks behind the river, with some lovely bars and restaurants with tables and chairs overlooking the river.

I don't have any real complaints about this hotel. The only slightly disappointing things were that there was no kettle in the room for making tea and coffee, although there were facilities for doing this in the lobby. Also, while the hotel offers free wifi access, you need to take your own laptop with you. The hotel has no computers available for business guests to check email, so I had to go to the internet cafe at Friedrichstrasse station. Next time, I would take my laptop with me and take advantage of the free wifi!

reviews.text: Just returned from a great trip to Berlin. Stayed 3 nights at the Best Western Mite and would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect for enjoying all of Berlins sights and attractions. There are plenty of restaurants and bars close to the hotel and you are only a 5 minute walk away from the S Bhan station (train).
reviews.title: What a great hotel!!

reviews.text: This is a very trendy designer-style hotel (beige-brown modernist furniture, walk-in shower and all that) on a budget (paid just under EUR 75). It's ideally located near Bahnhof Friedrichstrasse, from where there are connections all across the city (if you come from Tegel, take the Underground exit Oranienburger Strasse - it's closer). The Deutsche Theater is just around the corner. At the moment, there is still a construction site opposite, and the rooms are not 100% soundproof, although as the previous reviewer said, there are noisier places. One of the drawbacks is that the rooms are very small and that the toilets, while separate in contrast to the shower, are very basic. This whole bath area may have fashionable aspirations, bur is a bit reminiscent of en-suite student accommodation; perhaps an area they should have invested a bit more in.
reviews.title: Fashionable but small
